div.head: The CHARGE.
div.p: FORASMUCH as You, by the Providence of GOD, are call'd to the Work of the Goſpel Miniſtry, and have now declar'd your Readineſs to receive it of the Lord: We therefore, in the Name of our Lord JESUS CHRIST, and by Virtue of the Authority derived from Him, do, with the ancient Rite of the Laying on of the Hands of the Presbytery, conſtitute and ordain you a Miniſter of the Church of Chriſt; Now hereby committing unto you, the Keys of the Kingdom of Heaven; namely, the whole Adminiſtration of the Goſpel of Chriſt, as it conſiſts in
Delivering the Doctrines of Chriſt, by the preaching the everlaſting Goſpel;
The Adminiſtration of the Sacraments of the New-Teſtament;
The diſpenſing the holy Diſcipline of his Church;
And, Bleſſing with Authority in the Name of the Lord.
And we hereby alſo commit to you the paſtoral Care of this particular Church of Chriſt, who have now requeſted you to take upon yourſelf this honourable Burden.

We therefore now Charge you, in the Preſence of the Great GOD, and before our Lord Jeſus Chriſt, the great Head and only univerſal Paſtor of the Church, That you take heed unto the Miniſtry you have now received of the Lord, that you fulfill it: that you may hereafter give up your 〈◊〉 with Joy: That you be a Man of Prayer as it becomes a Man of GOD; that you therefore pray without Ceaſing:
That you give yourſelf to Reading and Meditation:

That you take heed to inſtruct, and thereby to feed, this Flock of GOD, with Food convenient for them; endeavouring (the great Shepherd aſſiſting you) to cauſe them to lie down in green 'Paſtures, and lead them beſide the ſtill Waters, that they may be fat and flourishing.

That you therefore preach the Word of GOD in Truth; that (your Doctrine being exactly conformable to that of
the holy Scriptures) you ſhew Uncorruptneſs, Gravity, Sincerity, that thereby you may build up this Church on the Foundation of the Apoſtles & Prophets, Jeſus Chriſt himſelf being the chief Corner Stone: That you therefore preach the Word inſtructively & plainly, that you enforce it ſtrongly, that you reprove wiſely and cautiouſly, yet with Courage and Authority, and sharply if need be, ſuffering no Man to deſpiſe you; that you exhort with all long ſuffering & ſweetneſs of Affection; & that and in all, you ſtudy to approve yourſelf to GOD & to your own Conſcience, a Workman that needeth not to be aſhamed.
That you adminiſter the Sacraments of the New Teſtament;
Baptiſm to viſible Believers and their Seed;
The Lord's Supper to ſuch as are of a regular Behaviour in Life, and are able (examining themſelves) to diſcern the Lord's Body
That you diſpenſe the Diſcipline of the Church of Chriſt with all Courage, Diſcretion and Impartiality, fearing the Face of no Man, nor having any Man's Perſon in Admiration becauſe of Advantage.

Moreover, We Charge you that you teach and inſtruct this People by your Example as well as by your Doctrine, that you always (ſetting before you our Lord Jeſus Chriſt as the great Pattern of your Life & Converſation) behave yourſelf in all Sanctity of Manners; in all Things ſhewing youſelf a Pattern of Good Works, which cannot be condemned, that he that is of the contrary Part may be aſhamed, having no evil Thing to ſay of you. That you exerciſe yourſelf to Piety and Devotion towards GOD, and Love and Charity towards theſe your Brethren, thereby greatly recommending the Doctrines of our Lord and Saviour which you ſhall preach, that others ſeeing your good Works may glorify our heavenly Father. And for your Encouragement to be watchful in all theſe Duties of your Miniſtry, we declare unto you. That if you ſhall faithfully keep this Charge, if you ſhall thus take heed to yourſelf and to your Doctrine, and to the Flock over which the Holy Chriſt hath now made you an Overſeer, you ſhall both ſave yourſelf and them that hear you. If you ſhall be thus wiſe, you ſhall hereafter ſhine as the brightneſs of the Firmament, and as a Star forever and ever; for then when our Lord Jeſus Chriſt ſhall appear, you ſhall alſo appear with Him, attired with a beautiful and a glorious Crown, Whoſe Luſtre ſhall never fade away.

div.head: The Right Hand of FELLOWSHIP.
div.p: AS the thruſting forth Labourers into His Harveſt, is to be aſcribed to the Care, Grace, and Faithfulneſs of the Lord Jeſus Chriſt, the ſovereign Head of the Church; ſo there is a wonderful Wiſdom, Goodneſs and Condeſcention diſcovered in the Order and Manner wherein this is done by Him: He having veſted his Churches with a gracious Liberty of chuſing, from amongſt thoſe, whom the Head of Influences, has raiſed up, qualified, and diſpoſed to that ſacred Employment, ſuch, as upon their ſincere and ardent Addreſſes to Him for Direction, and the Exerciſe of their own beſt Judgment and Diſcretion, they ſhall think moſt likely to promote the great Ends of GOD's Glory, and the Good of precious Souls, in the midſt of them.

That the Churches of Chriſt are by Him veſted with this Liberty, and indulg'd this Privilege, is evident from their Uſage in the primitive Times of Chriſtianity; and may be fairly argued even from the ſacred Scriptures themſelves: and particularly from Acts 14. 23. which Text rendered in our Tranſlation, And when they had ordained them Elders in every City, is rendered by Rev Beza, Quum
que ipſis per ſuffragia cr •• ſſent per ſingulas Eccleſias Presbyteros i. e. When they had by the Suſſtages or Votes of the People created them Elders in every Church. And that this Tranſlation is juſt, has been allow'd and pleaded by many, the beſt Expoſitors, who have underſtood and well conſidered the Import of the Word 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , uſed in the Text.

And however this Priviledge or Liberty of electing their own Paſtors, has on occaſion of the Abuſe of it by the Churches themſelves, or the aſſuming Diſpoſition of thoſe who have had the Aſcendency over them, or both, been taken away from many of the Churches of our Lord Jeſus Chriſt; the taking away whereof is, by Rev. Calvin, ſtiled
Impia Eccleſiae ſpoliatio (an ungodly robbing the Church) Yet the Churches of New England have hitherto enjoyed the quiet Poſſeſion of it. And may it pleaſe GOD to direct and enable them always ſo to uſe the ſame, as that they may not, by a ſinful Inconſideration, Raſhneſs, Partiality, and factious Behaviour, provoke our compaſſionate Redeemer to ſuffer them to be diveſted of it.

It is too notorious to be diſſembled that in the Elections of Paſtors in ſome of our Churches and Congregations, there has been a lamentable Looſe given to Men's Humours, Luſts, and Paſſions; than which there can ſcarce be named a more awful Evidence of the Decay of vital Piety, or a more pregnant Symptom of the Withdrawings of the gracious Preſence of Chriſt from His People. Yet, nevertheleſs (and to GOD's Praiſe be it ſpoken!) we have had from time to time many Inſtances, wherein, making the neceſſary Abatements for humane Frailty, this Tranſaction has been proceeded to and managed in our Churches, with a Seriouſneſs and Order, agreable to the Importance of the Matter, and becoming a People ſo much indulg'd and highly favoured of the Lord

And it is Matter of Rejoycing to us, that we have beheld ſo much of the Fruits of the Spirit of Chriſt, in that Order, Peace, and Unanimity, with which you, our honoured and dear Brethren in Chriſt, have proceeded in your Choice of the worthy Perſon now ſet over you in the Lord

And having ſeen you now renewedly ſignify your Deſires of him for your Paſtor, and heard him, with an expreſs Dependence upon Chriſt the glorious Head of Influences, complying with your Deſires herein, and devoting himſelf to the evangelical Miniſtry; yea further, having ſeen him in a ſolemn Manner ſeperated or ordained to the paſtoral Office, by Prayer and laying on of the Hands of the Presbytery. — There can remain no imaginable Ground, whereupon to withhold from him, thoſe Acknowledgments, Wiſhes Hopes and Promiſes, which have been wont to be expreſs'd by the Elderſhip, unto ſuch as from time to time it hath pleaſed our aſcended Lord to add unto their Number.

Which therefore, being thereto deputed, (tho' unworthy of a ſtanding amongſt them) I ſhall now, in the Name of the Elderſhip, expreſs, by giving you, Reverend and Dear SIR, The Right Hand of our Fellowſhip; hereby teſtifying
our Gratitude to the great Head of the Church, our Lord Jeſus Chriſt, for thoſe miniſterial Gifts and Graces we perceive to be in you; Our ſincere Wiſhes, that they may continued, increaſed and multiplied upon you; and our Hopes, that you will ſo employ them all, as to approve yourſelf a Workman that need not be aſhamed.

We would alſo hereby be underſtood to expreſs our Satisfaction in your call to the Goſpel Miniſtry, and to own and aſſert the Validity and Fulneſs of your Ordination to that ſacred Office. And that thereupon we own you as a Biſhop, Elder, or Paſtor, in the Church of Chriſt, ſpecially in this Part of it, over which, as we truſt, the Holy Ghoſt hath now made you an Overſeer; and that with hearty Love and Affection, we receive you into the Fellowſhip of our Miniſtry, and as our Equal in Point of Office.

Aſſuring you, That, as GOD ſhall enable and need require, we ſhall readily give you the Aſſiſtance of our Prayers and Advice from time to time, and ſhall always rejoyce to ſee the Work of the Lord proſpering in your Hands.

And now, Reverend and Dear Brother, ſuffer me to obſerve to you, That we take your thus receiving the Right Hand of our Fellowſhip, as expreſſive on your Part of the ſame Acknowledgments, Wiſhes, Hopes and Promiſes, towards us. And may it pleaſe GOD to help you and us, to bear in Mind theſe mutual and endearing Engagements, for the ſtrengthening our holy Fellowſhip, and not ſuffer them to paſs away as Words of Courſe or an empty Formality.

Verily, SIR, from our own Experience we can aſſure you, the Work you are engaged in is a laborious & difficult Work: A Work wherein you muſt expect to meet with great Oppoſition: A Work therefore in order to the due Diſcharge whereof you muſt arm yourſelf with Patience and Reſolution, always relying upon Chriſt, in whom all fulneſs dwells, and remembring that you watch for Men's Souls as one that muſt give an Account.

And may it pleaſe our glorious Redeemer, always to afford his promiſed Preſence with you, and to cauſe his Grace to be ſufficient for you! May you be wiſe to win Souls, and inſtrumental of turning many unto Righteouſneſs, who may be your Hope, your Joy and Crown of Rejoycing, in the Preſence of our Lord Jeſus Chriſt at His Coming.
